exercises.text: Zagreb je grad u _____ živi više od 800.000 ljudi.
exercises.explanation: Locative masculine singular—'u kojem/kojemu' refers to 'grad'. Both short and long forms are correct.

exercises.text: Ovo je park kroz _____ prolazim svaki dan.
exercises.explanation: Accusative masculine singular—'kroz koji' refers to 'park'.

exercises.text: Gledali smo film o djevojci za _____ nitko nije znao.
exercises.explanation: Accusative feminine singular—'za koju' refers to 'djevojka'.

exercises.text: To su prijatelji s _____ često putujem.
exercises.explanation: Instrumental plural—'s kojima/kojim' refers to 'prijatelji'. Both forms are correct.

exercises.text: Posjetili smo mjesta u _____ su snimali film.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—'u kojima/kojim' refers to the neuter plural noun 'mjesta'. Both the long form 'kojima' and the short form 'kojim' are correct.

exercises.text: Ovo su zadaci na _____ još nisam odgovorio.
exercises.explanation: Accusative plural—'na koje' refers to 'zadaci'. The phrase 'odgovoriti na' takes the accusative case.

exercises.text: Profesorica je dala temu o _____ ćemo raspravljati sutra.
exercises.explanation: Locative feminine singular—'o kojoj' refers to 'tema'.

exercises.text: To je knjiga iz _____ sam učio gramatiku.
exercises.explanation: Genitive feminine singular—The preposition 'iz' takes the genitive case. 'iz koje' refers to 'knjiga'.

exercises.text: To su učenici s _____ sam bio na natjecanju.
exercises.explanation: Instrumental plural—'s kojima/kojim' refers to 'učenici'.

exercises.text: Imam zadatak za _____ mi treba pomoć.
exercises.explanation: Accusative masculine singular—'za koji' refers to 'zadatak'.

exercises.text: To je trgovina u _____ kupujem kruh.
exercises.explanation: Locative feminine singular—'u kojoj' refers to 'trgovina'.

exercises.text: Ovo su kolači bez _____ ne slavim rođendan.
exercises.explanation: Genitive plural—'bez kojih' refers to 'kolači'.

exercises.text: Ovo je čokolada na _____ sam potrošio zadnji novac.
exercises.explanation: Accusative feminine singular—'na koju' refers to 'čokolada'.

exercises.text: To su proizvodi o _____ često čitam recenzije.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—'o kojima/kojim' refers to 'proizvodi'.

exercises.text: To je kafić u _____ se uvijek nalazimo.
exercises.explanation: Locative masculine singular—'u kojem/kojemu' refers to 'kafić'.

exercises.text: Ovo je autobus s _____ sam putovao u Split.
exercises.explanation: Instrumental masculine singular—'s kojim' refers to 'autobus'.

exercises.text: Imam kartu za vlak u _____ ima puno mjesta.
exercises.explanation: Locative masculine singular—'u kojem/kojemu' refers to 'vlak'.

exercises.text: Posjetio sam otoke o _____ sam dugo sanjao.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—The verb 'sanjati o' (to dream about) takes the locative case. 'o kojima/kojim' refers to 'otoci'.

exercises.text: To su hoteli u _____ su odsjeli moji roditelji.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—'u kojima/kojim' refers to 'hoteli'.

exercises.text: To je plaža na _____ smo igrali odbojku.
exercises.explanation: Locative feminine singular—'na kojoj' refers to 'plaža'.

exercises.text: Ovo je računalo na _____ radim svaki dan.
exercises.explanation: Locative neuter singular—'na kojem/kojemu' refers to 'računalo'.

exercises.text: To su uređaji bez _____ više ne mogu zamisliti dan.
exercises.explanation: Genitive plural—'bez kojih' refers to 'uređaji'.

exercises.text: Ovo su aplikacije u _____ se može učiti jezike.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—'u kojima/kojim' refers to 'aplikacije'.

exercises.text: To je mobitel s _____ često fotografiram.
exercises.explanation: Instrumental masculine singular—'s kojim' refers to 'mobitel'.

exercises.text: Imam tablet za _____ koristim posebnu olovku.
exercises.explanation: Accusative masculine singular—'za koji' refers to 'tablet'.

exercises.text: Ovo su tenisice u _____ ću ići na Inmusic Festival.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—'u kojima/kojim' refers to 'tenisice'.

exercises.text: To je tim za _____ navijam od djetinjstva.
exercises.explanation: Accusative masculine singular—'za koji' refers to 'tim'.

exercises.text: Gledam utakmicu u _____ igra moj brat.
exercises.explanation: Locative feminine singular—'u kojoj' refers to 'utakmica'.

exercises.text: To su pjesme uz _____ uvijek plešem.
exercises.explanation: Accusative plural—'uz koje' refers to 'pjesme'.

exercises.text: Ovo je glumac o _____ svi pričaju.
exercises.explanation: Locative masculine singular—'o kojem/kojemu' refers to 'glumac'.

exercises.text: Volim piti kavu s ljudima s _____ ne moram puno pričati.
exercises.explanation: Instrumental plural—'s kojima/kojim' refers to 'ljudima'.

exercises.text: To su prijateljice za _____ bih sve učinila.
exercises.explanation: Accusative feminine plural—'za koje' refers to 'prijateljice'.

exercises.text: On je netko u _____ uvijek mogu imati povjerenja.
exercises.explanation: Accusative masculine singular—The phrase 'imati povjerenja u nekoga' takes the accusative case. 'u kojeg(a)' refers to 'netko'. Both the short form 'kojeg' and long form 'kojega' are correct.

exercises.text: To su priče o _____ često razgovaramo.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—'o kojima/kojim' refers to 'priče'.

exercises.text: To je prijatelj na _____ uvijek mogu računati.
exercises.explanation: Accusative masculine singular—The phrase 'računati na nekoga' takes the accusative case. 'na kojeg(a)' refers to 'prijatelj'. Both the short form 'kojeg' and long form 'kojega' are correct.

exercises.text: To su mjesta na _____ često idem na izlete.
exercises.explanation: Accusative plural—'na koja' refers to 'mjesta'. The preposition 'na' with a verb of motion takes the accusative.

exercises.text: Ovo su drveća ispod _____ sjedimo ljeti.
exercises.explanation: Genitive plural—The preposition 'ispod' takes the genitive case. 'ispod kojih' refers to 'drveća'.

exercises.text: To je park iz _____ se pruža lijep pogled.
exercises.explanation: Genitive masculine singular—The preposition 'iz' takes the genitive case. 'iz kojeg(a)' refers to 'park'. Both the short form 'kojeg' and long form 'kojega' are correct.

exercises.text: Ovo je staza po _____ trčimo svakog jutra.
exercises.explanation: Locative feminine singular—The preposition 'po' indicating movement across a surface takes the locative case. 'po kojoj' refers to 'staza'.

exercises.text: To su životinje o _____ smo učili u školi.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—'o kojima/kojim' refers to 'životinje'.

exercises.text: To je knjiga o _____ smo razgovarali.
exercises.explanation: Locative feminine singular—'o kojoj' refers to 'knjiga'.

exercises.text: To su slike o _____ pišu poznati kritičari.
exercises.explanation: Locative plural—The verb 'pisati o' (to write about) takes the locative case. 'o kojima/kojim' refers to 'slike'.

exercises.text: To je muzej u _____ je izložena slavna skulptura.
exercises.explanation: Locative masculine singular—'u kojem/kojemu' refers to 'muzej'.

exercises.text: To su pjesme bez _____ ne mogu zamisliti ljeto.
exercises.explanation: Genitive plural—'bez kojih' refers to 'pjesme'.

exercises.text: To je film u _____ igra moj omiljeni glumac.
exercises.explanation: Locative masculine singular—'u kojem/kojemu' refers to 'film'.
